intro: Haumaniastrum gracile, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual with slender, branching stems and small, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant produces white to pale pink blossoms that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in full sun with minimal water requirements. Haumaniastrum gracile is well adapted to harsh desert environments, showcasing resilience through its rapid growth cycle and efficient water use.
